title: South Live: Tuesday 16 January - BBC News
summary: army bids farewell to lynx helicopter .

documents.title: that 's all folks !
text: thank you for joining us today .
we will be back with all of the region 's latest news , travel and sport tomorrow at 08:00 .
have a good evening .

documents.title: fa cup third round replay analysis : reading vs stevenage
text: at the moment , reading manager jaap stam just needs a win .
it does n't matter where that victory comes from , just crucial it comes soon .
tonight 's fa cup third round replay against stevenage will be the ninth game since the royals last won , all the way back at the start of december .
the clash against the mid-table league two side offers the perfect opportunity to disrupt that disappointing run .
if reading do get the win , a fourth round tie against carlisle or sheffield wednesday awaits .
that outcome , though , is by no means guaranteed .
full build-up to the match can be found here .
author: Jack Winstanley
BBC Berkshire Sport Reporter

documents.title: army bids farewell to lynx helicopter
text: army bids farewell to lynx helicopter

documents.title: commissioner `` not supportive '' of scrapping mounted police
text: the police commissioner for thames valley has told the bbc he does not want the force to disband its mounted section .
thames valley police said scrapping its mounted section was one of three options which will be put forward to mr stansfeld at a budget meeting on 23 january .
other options put forward by chief constable francis habgood will be to maintain the unit in its current format or restructure it to `` deliver savings '' .
pc craig o'leary , the force 's federation chairman , said the removal of the unit would be a `` sad loss '' .
the officers and horses are deployed to maintain public order at football matches and events .
`` the meeting where i will consider the chief constable 's budget options and proposals is next week .
at this time i am not supportive of the option to disband the mounted section . ''

documents.title: trio extend stay at london irish
text: trio extend stay at london irish

documents.title: reading nursery reopens after ofsted suspension
text: a nursery has reopened in reading after it was shut due to `` serious concerns '' about its leadership and management .
the owners of greyfriars day nursery said they were `` deeply sorry '' for the `` disruption and inconvenience '' caused by its closure in november .
the child care service was suspended by ofsted after its manager left without notice , but it reopened on monday .
the nursery has employed new staff and held an open day for parents to meet the new management team .

documents.title: does mp nod off during ken clarke speech ?
text: does mp nod off during ken clarke speech ?

documents.title: inquest opened into slough train station death
text: an inquest has been opened into the death of a pregnant woman at slough train station .
zdenka yabani , 39 , of merton road , slough died after being hit by a train on 8 january , reading coroners court said .
officers from british transport police were called to the scene at 08:51 gmt where they discovered the body of a woman .
a date for a full inquest is yet to be set .

documents.title: west berkshire council shake-up after boundary reshuffle
text: west berkshire is to lose nine councillors as new boundaries are drawn for each council ward across the district .
in future it will be represented by 43 councillors under the recommendations from the independent local government boundary commission for england .
commission chair colin mellors said : `` we believe these recommendations deliver electoral fairness for voters as well as reflecting community ties throughout west berkshire . ''
the new arrangements must now be implemented by parliament and will come into force at the council elections in 2019 .

documents.title: dead boy 's twin rides on funeral carriage
text: dead boy 's twin rides on funeral carriage

documents.title: antique dealers snubbed by agricultural show
text: the antiques section of the long-running new forest and hampshire county show has been ditched in `` drastic changes '' made to the format by the organisers .
the agricultural show said it made the decision after visitors complained the layout and attractions were the same year-on-year .
those who run the antiques section received a letter from the organisers saying it is no longer required .
among the events this year will be jamie squibb freestyle motocross display , cattle milking demonstrations and the show 's first-ever baking competition called bake and cake .
@ twitterid morning .
this is what our friend got after 35 years of running one of the largest marquees .
# newforest

documents.title: england 's first 'prisoner of war ' discovered
text: the earliest known use of the term `` prisoner of war '' in england has been discovered by a historian at the university of southampton .
court documents from 1357 show the term first used for the count de ventadour , captured at the battle of poitiers .
`` it 's possible this early use of the phrase was prompted by the very large number of soldiers captured at poitiers , '' says dr remy ambuhl .
this suggests a `` new phrase linked to a new status '' , says dr ambuhl .
but dr ambuhl says his research has shown that the legal `` rights '' attached to a medieval prisoner of war were not about protecting the captured soldier .

documents.title: rescue team to free entangled humpback whale off dorset
text: plans are under way to help a humpback whale seen off the dorset coast entangled in fishing gear .
the animal was spotted off chesil cove with what is thought to be an orange lobster pot buoy and netting attached .
british divers marine life rescue said a team was preparing to assist the whale once winds and high waves drop .
the rescue team is asking the public to report any sightings to help them track it , as the whale is moving around in the area .

documents.title: missing weymouth woman has been located
text: police are pleased to say they have found an elderly woman who had been reported missing in weymouth overnight .
irene cardwell , 84 , had failed to return home after walking into town at 18:30 on monday .

documents.title: 'thomas hardy ' wool bridge collapses into river frome
text: an elizabethan bridge that features in thomas hardy 's novel tess of the d'urbervilles has partially collapsed and been washed away .
cracks began to appear on the grade ii listed wool bridge , which crosses the river frome in dorset , on thursday .
since then the wall foundation has `` slumped '' and been washed away , a county council spokesperson said .
the bridge has been closed to traffic for many years , except for pedestrians and cyclists , she added .

documents.title: man charged after m3 crash lorry sheds paper and diesel
text: a man has been charged after a lorry carrying 20 tonnes of paper overturned , forcing a partial closure of the m3 .
the vehicle also shed about 32 gallons ( 150 litres ) of diesel on the southbound road near junction 12 at eastleigh on sunday night .
a crash barrier was also damaged .
the man , 50 , is in custody accused of driving without due care and attention and failing to provide a specimen .
the man , from scunthorpe , lincolnshire , is due before southampton magistrates .

documents.title: snow on the way possibly
text: a yellow warning for snow and ice is in place for hampshire and dorset from now until 11:00 tomorrow .
author: John Baish
BBC South

documents.title: breakingman jailed after harassing maitlis
text: a former friend of newsnight presenter emily maitlis , who harassed the bbc journalist for more than 20 years , has been jailed .
edward vines , 47 , was issued with a restraining order in 2009 , which he was convicted of twice breaching last year .
he initially admitted two breaches in november , but later tried unsuccessfully to alter his plea .
vines of clarkes row , oxford , was sentenced to 45 months at the city 's crown court .

documents.title: south weather : wintery showers
text: south weather : wintery showers

documents.title: carillion workers in the south fear for their jobs
text: people in the south of england working for companies owed money by carillion are at risk of losing their jobs .
the construction giant , which remodelled reading train station , has collapsed , leaving debts of £ 1.5bn .
it announced on monday it is entering into immediate compulsory liquidation .
the government has promised that staff working on public services and projects for carillion will continue to be paid .

documents.title: hospitals still paying millions for mistakes over 20 years ago
text: medical blunders dating back more than two decades are still costing the nhs millions of pounds a year in compensation .
in the south , hospital trusts have paid out almost £ 9m since 2012 for mistakes made before 1995 , analysis by the bbc has revealed .
royal berkshire hospital 's back-dated negligence bill is the highest in the region at £ 4m , followed by portsmouth hospitals trust at £ 2.8m and poole hospital at £ 1.3m .
others include dorset county hospital ( £ 328,000 ) , heatherwood and wexham park trust ( £ 110,000 ) and hampshire hospitals trust ( £ 9,000 ) .

documents.title: a329 ( m ) accident cleared
text: traffic has returned to normal and the road cleared following an accident earlier on a329 ( m ) southbound at m4 j10 ( wokingham/ bracknell ) .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: take off for army air corps lynx farewell flight
text: four lynx helicopters have taken off on a commemorative flight to mark their decommissioning from army air corps .
they took off from rah odiham in hampshire on an aerial tour culminating in a v-shaped `` air procession '' along the river thames in central london .

documents.title: appeal to find missing 84-year-old woman in weymouth
text: officers have been searching overnight for an elderly woman who has gone missing in weymouth .
irene cardwell , 84 , suffers from poor memory and left her home at 18:30 on monday to walk into town but was reported missing just before 01:00 today after she failed to return .
she is described as white , 5ft 6in ( 1.7m ) tall , medium build , with grey hair .
she was wearing a black overcoat and carrying a dark-coloured handbag , and is said to walk lopsided .

documents.title: live : army air corps lynx farewell tour
text: watch the takeoff live on the army air corps facebook page .

documents.title: new lynx paintwork for army air corps farewell tour
text: the army air corps ' # lynxhelicopter makes its last flight in british military service today .
here 's a sneak preview of the paintwork on the lynx that will lead the commemorative air procession around the country .
it 's our huey .
but much better .
the little chopper with the big attitude .
and great at tree hopping !
at least we have the wildcats
and they can chase gazelles .
i love the sound of a gazelle
i was lucky enough to be flown in a gazelle , the pilot thought he be clever and try the flying stunts and try to make me sick .
did n't work , told him later in the naffi that i flew gliders and and my instructor was a stunt pilot .
i did gliding for a while at laarbruch but ive never flown in any military helicopters , just a couple of civvy ones
at least the copters you were in were very comfortable , did you get silver service and in flight movie ?
i name it scorpion
in france @ twitterid still makes sa 316 alouette iii flight so for us you could set a retirement date about 2060 for # lynxhelicopter
just hearing those engines in the distance when cold wet and tired after 7day patrolls on op banner coming to us up , the warm blast of hot air will stay with me for ever
could n't have put it better myself mate
sad to see it go scott
piece of military history there
we had our coy pic on ballykelly airfield with 2 lynx hovering just above us
i 've got one of b coy at the mill with a puma hovering .
i think c coy had lynx
have you seen this film yet
great movie mate

documents.title: raf odiham prepares for lynx farewell tour takeoff
text: it 's a very emotional morning here at raf odiham .
age has finally caught up with the lynx - its time is up .
there was an eerie calm over the tarmac as we were guided in by military staff .
there is masses of media interest here and at the centre of it all are the five lynx helicopters preparing to take off on their farewell tour .
they were introduced in 1978 and quickly became the most versatile pieces of kit for both the army and the navy .
author: Luke De Costa
BBC Radio Solent reporter

documents.title: lynx set for farewell aerial tour
text: it 's eyes-to-the-skies today as the army air corps prepares to say farewell to its lynx helicopters .
the aircraft is being decommissioned after 40 years of service during which it has been deployed to locations including northern ireland , bosnia , kuwait , afghanistan and sierra leone .
an aerial tour of five lynx is due to start from raf odiham at about 09:00 and is due to reach london for a v-shaped `` air procession '' along the river thames at 15:50 .

documents.title: army bids farewell to lynx helicopter with flypast tour
text: the army is set to bid farewell to the lynx helicopter with a commemorative flight .
the aircraft is to be decommissioned after almost 40 years in service .
remaining lynx are due to leave from raf odiham in hampshire on an aerial tour taking in military bases and locations associated with the helicopter .
the flight will culminate in a v-shaped `` air procession '' along the river thames in central london .

documents.title: flooding closes southampton road
text: flooding has led to the closure of a section of a road in southampton .
test lane which runs between the m271 and a35 has been closed due to deep flood water on the road .
test lane is closed in both directions from the ship inn area up to past the gover road junction , due to flooding .
please find an alternative route .

documents.title: good morning
text: good morning and welcome to bbc south live .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport and weather from across the region until 18:00 .
you can get in touch with your and news on our berkshire , hampshire , dorset and oxford facebook pages , or by using twitter @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid
